age.intro: Hi! Our coronavirus disease self assessment scan has been developed on the basis of guidelines from the WHO and MHFW, Government of India. This interaction should not be taken as expert medical advice. Any information you share with us will be kept strictly confidential.
age.question: How old are you?

temperature.question: Please let us know your current body temperature in degree Fahrenheit (Normal body temperature is 98.6°F):

symptoms.question: Are you experiencing any of the symptoms below (mark all those applicable)

options.text: Loss or diminished sense of smell

additionalSymptoms.question: Additionally, please verify if you are experiencing any of the symptoms below (mark all those applicable)

options.text: Persistant Pain and Pressure in Chest

exposureHistory.question: Please select your travel and exposure details

options.text: No contact with anyone with Symptoms
History of travel or meeting in affected geographical area in last 14 days
Close Contact with confirmed COVID in last 14 days

underlyingConditions.question: Do you have a history of any of these conditions (mark all those applicable)

progress.question: How have your symptoms progressed over the last 48 hrs?

language.question: Hello, Please tell us which language you'd like to take this test in:

lowRecommendations.title: Based on your inputs,  advises the following:
list: Stay home and take care of yourself in home isolation
Prevention and precautions See Below
Laboratory tests and imaging are optional (and as per your physician’s advise)
COVID 19 testing may be required at your physician’s advise
Monitor your symptoms and get medical attention if your situation worsens

highRecommendations.title: Basis on your scan result, here are  recommendations:
list: Seek immediate medical attention and get yourself tested
Please visit a physician as there may be a requirement for further care
COVID 19 testing may be needed at your physician’s advise
Prevention and Precautions See Below
Laboratory tests and imaging may be needed as per your physician's advise
Monitor your symptoms and isolate yourself
You can consult online here to speak to a physician immediately

mediumRecommendations.title: Basis on your scan result, here are  recommendations:
list: Consult a physician and start home isolation immediately
Prevention and precautions See Below
Laboratory tests and imaging may be needed as per your physician's advise
COVID 19 testing may be required at your physician’s advise
Monitor your symptoms and get medical attention if your situation worsens

suggestions.heading: Prevention and Precautions - Basic protective measures
suggestions.info1: Be aware or Educate yourself with the latest updates on the following websites : WHO & MoHFW
suggestions.info2: Most people who become infected experience mild illness and recover, but it can be more severe for others. Take care of your health and protect others by doing the following:

list.heading: Wash your hands frequently
list.info: Regularly and thoroughly clean your hands with an alcohol-based hand rub or wash them with soap and water.

list.heading: Maintain social distancing
list.info: Maintain at least 2 metre (6 feet) distance between yourself and anyone who is coughing or sneezing.

list.heading: Avoid touching eyes, nose and mouth
list.info: Our hands touch many surfaces and can pick up viruses. Once contaminated, hands can transfer the virus to your eyes, nose or mouth.

list.heading: Practice respiratory hygiene
list.info: Make sure you and the people around you, follow good respiratory hygiene. This means covering your mouth and nose with your bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze. Then dispose of the used tissue immediately.

list.heading: If you have fever, cough and difficulty in breathing, seek medical care early
list.info: Stay home if you feel unwell. If you have a high fever, moderate to severe cough and difficulty in breathing and it is worsening in short period of time, seek medical asistance and call in advance.

sbi.heading: Disclaimer
sbi.info: SBI does not make any representation and is not responsible for the content or information presented here.
